div.p: Arquivo da Correspondência do Dr Júlio Henriques, Biblioteca do Departmento de Botânica, Universidade de Coimbra, Coimbra.

La haute distinction, que sa Majesté le Roi de Portugal à daigné m'accorder en m'élevant au rang de Commandeur de noble Ordre de St. Iago a gagné beaucoup plus de valeur dans mon estimation par la générosité de la Faculté des sciences naturelles de l'ancienne et célébre Université de Coimbra en m'envoyant l'ensigne
insigne? precieuse de cette Ordre avec sa dedication. Je vous prie donc d'assurer la Faculté honorée de ma sincère reconnaisance et de ma profonde estime.

Il me fera beaucoup de privilége de rester en communication avec votre institution, et j'ai l'honneur de vous transmettre par cette malle un petit paquet des graines Australiennes pour votre jardin botanique, aussi bien que quelques brochures par faveur de Mons. le Professeur Colmeiro, le Directeur du jardin botanique à Madrid.
Agréez, Monsieur, l'assurance de mon estime et de ma consideration.

div.p: Mons. le Professeur Julio Augusto Henriques, &c &c
Secretair de la Faculté des sciences naturelles

I have had the honour of receiving your letter of 2 July; ad it has given me much pleasure to learn that the Todea fern has arrived in good condition,
Mentioned in Journal de horticultura practicá, vol. 3 (1872), p. 80. and that the University of Coimbra has accepted my books so graciously as a contribution to its rich and important library.

The high distinction that His Majesty the King of Portugal has deigned to confer on me by raising me to the rank of Commander of the noble Order of St Iago has gained much greater value in my estimation through the generosity of the Faculty of Natural Sciences of the ancient and celebrated University of Coimbra in sending me the precious badge of that Order with its dedication. I therefore beg you to assure the honoured Faculty of my sincere gratitude and deep respect.

It will be a great privilege for me to remain in communication with your institution, and I have the honour of sending you by this mail a small packet of Australian seeds for your botanic garden, as well as some brochures courtesy of Professor Colmeiro, Director of the botanic garden at Madrid.
With the assurance, Sir, of my esteem and regards,
